description.plain:
Kirsnick Khari Ball (June 18, 1994 – November 1, 2022), better known by his stage name Takeoff, was 1/3 of Migos, alongside his uncle, Quavo, and Quavo’s cousin, Offset.

Takeoff started making beats and developing rhythms in the seventh grade, but didn’t start taking music seriously until 2011. His individual career was initiated when he released his debut solo album The Last Rocket on November 2, 2018.

On November 1, 2022, Takeoff was shot and killed while in Houston with his uncle and musical collaborator Quavo after an altercation began, possibly started by a dice game that Quavo was involved in. Takeoff was 28 years old.

body.plain:
Kirsnick Khari Ball (June 18, 1994 – November 1, 2022), better known by his stage name Takeoff, was 1/3 of Migos, alongside his uncle, Quavo, and Quavo’s cousin, Offset.

Takeoff started making beats and developing rhythms in the seventh grade, but didn’t start taking music seriously until 2011. His individual career was initiated when he released his debut solo album The Last Rocket on November 2, 2018.

On November 1, 2022, Takeoff was shot and killed while in Houston with his uncle and musical collaborator Quavo after an altercation began, possibly started by a dice game that Quavo was involved in. Takeoff was 28 years old.

songs.title: Casper

description.plain:
Originally teased on fellow Atlanta rapper and label-mate Lil Yachty’s Instagram Live, “Casper” features Takeoff utilizing a clever analogy, comparing his car, a ghost, and his ability as a rapper.

For his 24th birthday, Takeoff was gifted a Rolls Royce Wraith by his label Quality Control. Label founder Pierre “Pee” Thomas posted a video of the exchange on his Instagram.

A “wraith” is a ghost or ghastly image of someone, specifically seen shortly before or after death. This is representative of Takeoff’s lyricism and skill; he is going to “kill” any opposing rapper’s career, the last thing they see being and his car.

The track’s title “Casper” refers to popular character Casper the Ghost, who in the original film adaptation, was a twelve-year-old boy who died from pneumonia after playing out in the cold too long. This may be a deeper reference to Takeoff’s “frozen” state, due to being covered in “ice”, or expensive jewelry, which is a common theme among his and other Migos members' discographies.



The track is dual-produced: Atlanta producer Cassius Jay, who collaborated with Takeoff two other times on The Last Rocket, as well as numerous songs with other Migos members. It is also produced by Nonstop Da Hitman, a member of the songwriting/production collective 808 Mafia who has previously worked with Takeoff on multiple Migos' projects.

On November 27, 2018, a music video for “Casper” was released on the official Migos youtube channel:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vnddx3dS6Ks

songs.embed_content: Read “Casper” by Takeoff on Genius

songs.title: Last Memory

description.plain:
“Last Memory” is the lead single from The Last Rocket. It was released on October 26, 2018.

The song is about Takeoff’s wealth and success while also keeping the street life close to him.

songs.embed_content: Read “Last Memory” by Takeoff on Genius

songs.title: Infatuation

description.plain: According to Billboard, who was present at Takeoff’s album listening session, “Infatuation” is a standout track on The Last Rocket about admiring a crush from a distance in grade school and going to the skating rink with her. It is an R&B song with a 1980s/90s feel.
